column4: have you tried the sound recorder and alsamixer for your sound levels
type alsamixer in a terminal try to turn up the vol
master and pcm are both at 100

i followed this until the ./configure near the end. It said command not found. I rebooted after that
so you did not complete the install?
why ?  you stoped alsa to install that version thats why theres no sound. so you rebooted have you got sounnd?
It wouldn't recognize the command for some reason. I didn't really have another option, and no I don't
which command did you get stuck on?
I think I reinstalled it. I tried reinstalling the ALSA drivers from a fresh kernal. I'll come back and let you know. Thanks a lot for the help.
